qas.question: What party benefited from the accession of Valens?
Valens issued a decree banishing the bishops that were deposed by who?
What saint fled from Alexandria on 5 October to a country house outside Alexandria?
Valens' banishment of Athanasius created the greatest consternation in what city?
What did the decree of Valens do?

answers.text: banishing the bishops who had been deposed by Constantius

qas.question: When the people in the city were concerned about Athanasius, what did the prefect do?

answers.text: case of Athanasius would be laid before the emperor

qas.question: What did  Athanasius do to protect himself?
How did Valens get him to return?

answers.text: issued orders allowing Athanasius to return to his episcopal see

qas.question: What party didn't benefit from the accession of Valens?
Valens didn't issue a decree banishing the bishops that were deposed by who?
What did the decree of Valens not do?

context: The accession of Valens gave a fresh lease of life to the <a0_0><b8_0>Arian<b8_0/><a0_0/> party. He issued a decree <a4_0><b11_0>banishing the bishops<b11_0/> who had been deposed by <a1_0><b9_0>Constantius<b9_0/><a4_0/><a1_0/>, but who had been permitted by Jovian to return to their sees. The news created the greatest consternation in the city of <a3_0>Alexandria<a3_0/> itself, and the prefect, in order to prevent a serious outbreak, gave public assurance that the very special <a5_0>case of <a2_0>Athanasius<a2_0/> would be laid before the emperor<a5_0/>. But the saint seems to have divined what was preparing in secret against him. <b10_0>He quietly <a6_0>withdrew from Alexandria<b10_0/>, 5 October<a6_0/>, and took up his abode in a country house outside the city. Valens, who seems to have sincerely dreaded the possible consequences of another popular outbreak, within a few weeks <a7_0>issued orders allowing Athanasius to return to his episcopal see<a7_0/>.
